item.title: Leah add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "I have always wanted to write a book that ended with the word 'mayonnaise." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Leah add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "Sometimes life is merely a matter of coffee and whatever intimacy a cup of coffee affords." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Leah add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description:
"Im haunted a little this evening by feelings that have no vocabulary and events that should be explained in dimensions of lint rather than words.
Ive been examining half-scraps of my childhood. They are pieces of distant life that have no form or meaning. They are things that just happened like lint." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Leah add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "For the rest of my life I'll be thinking about that hamburger. I'll be sitting there at the counter, holding it in my hands with tears streaming down my cheeks. The waitress will be looking away because she doesn't like to see kids crying when they are eating hamburgers..." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Love is the ultimate outlaw. It just won't adhere to any rules. The most any of us can do is to sign on as its accomplice. Instead of vowing to honor and obey, maybe we should swear to aid and abet. That would mean that security is out of the question. The words "make" and "stay" become inappropriate. My love for you has no strings attached. I love you for free." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Just because you're naked doesn't mean you're sexy. Just because you're cynical doesn't mean you're cool." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Albert Camus wrote that the only serious question is whether to kill yourself or not. Tom Robbins wrote that the only serious question is whether time has a beginning and an end. Camus clearly got up on the wrong side of bed, and Robbins must have forgotten to set the alarm. There is only one serious question. And that is: Who knows how to make love stay? Answer me that and I will tell you whether or not to kill yourself." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "People tend the take everything too seriously. Especially themselves. Yep. And that's probably what makes 'em scared and hurt so much of the time. Life is too serious to take that seriously." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "It's never too late to have a happy childhood." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Religion is not merely the opium of the masses, it's the cyanide." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The Conch Shell´s tint was that of a vagina blowing bubble gum." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Leah add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "My mother began to go crazy. Not in a 'Let's paint the kitchen red!' sort of way. But crazy in a 'gas oven, toothpaste sandwhich, I am God' sort of way." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Leah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I never had any friends later on like the ones I had when I was 12 - Jesus, did you?" -- Stephen King

item.title: Leah add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness, starving hysterical naked, dragging themselves through the negro streets at dawn looking for an angry fix angelheaded hipsters burning for the ancient heavenly connection to the starry dynamo in the machinery of the night." -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Leah add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Leah add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "All grown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Leah add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Leah add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "The truth will set you free. Either that or it'll get you a punch in the nose. " -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "The only way you get Americans to notice anything is to tax them or draft them or kill them." -- John Irving

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "… and so he tried to accept the ache in his heart as what Dr. Larch would call the common symptoms of normal life." -- John Irving

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Society had a crime problem. It hired cops to attack crime. Now society has a cop problem." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Leah add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Leah add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "I have a new philosophy. I'm only going to dread one day at a time." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Leah add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I myself am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions." -- Augusten Burroughs
